node.text:
The Manhattan was the most famous cocktail in the world when it was invented in New York City’s Manhattan Club in the late 19th Century.

Its mix of American whiskey and Italian vermouth, enlivened with a few dashes of aromatic bitters, create the very definition of a timeless cocktail. #ThePoloBar

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Polo Bar in The Polo Bar - A Ralph Lauren Restaurant. May be an image of drink.

node.text:
Rosé Royale, The Polo Bar’s favorite summer cocktail, perfect to enjoy with friends & family this holiday weekend.

INGREDIENTS
 
½ ounce grapefruit liqueur
½ ounce Royal Combier or Grand Marnier
3 ounces rosé wine, chilled
2 ounces Champagne, chilled
Strip of pink-grapefruit or orange peel

In a large wine glass, combine the grapefruit liqueur and Royal Combier. Add the wine and Champagne. Add a few ice cubes and stir. Twist the grapefruit peel over the drink to release oils, then drop it into the cocktail.

node.text:
“The bravest choices you can make are to be who you are and remain true to whom you love.” — Ralph Lauren

A longtime ally of the LGBTQIA+ community, Ralph Lauren has always been inspired by those who champion creativity, love, and self-expression. As we enter #PrideMonth, we recognize how important it is to show up as our authentic selves, and advocate for the intersectional identities of our friends, families, and communities.

Still, the freedoms to express one’s true self and love whomever one chooses are not yet accessible for everyone, especially those in marginalized communities. That’s why it is more important than ever to continue advocating for the global LGBTQIA+ community’s right to love freely, create authentically, and be themselves.

Join us in our support of @StonewallFoundation: rlauren.co/Stonewall

#RLPride

node.text:
Enjoy the Kentucky Derby with a Polo Bar Mint Julep!

Mint Julep Smash

2 oz Stranahan’s Colorado Whiskey
½ oz Giffard Fraise des Bois
¾ oz Lemon juice
¼ oz Water
A handful of mint
Strawberries

Muddle mint and strawberries and combine all ingredients over crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and miniature polo mallet.

Photo courtesy of @VanityFair #ThePoloBar

node.text:
“Each restaurant has a different feeling inspired by the culture of the city, the architecture of the space, and of course the people, who in the end, give it a real personality." - Ralph Lauren

We are taking a closer look at some of the special elements that make The Polo Bar iconic.

First up: The exterior mural. It’s an enlarged version of a painting by Henry Koehler (1927-2018), a renowned sporting artist, admired especially for his equestrian-themed paintings of polo matches, fox hunts and horse races.

The mural is one of several Koehler pieces used throughout The Polo Bar to enhance its classic sporting club ambiance. Ralph Lauren followed Koehler’s career for years, appreciating his timeless artistry and the vibrant sophistication of his work. #ThePoloBar
